definition: happy knack for chancing upon fine food
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
to eat one's fill/to have a good meal

sentences.english: This packaging is a real treat.
There is so much litchi in Shenzhen. I can eat as many as I like.
sentences.chinese: 深圳的荔枝真多，我可以大飽口福了。

sentences.english: The fox really wanted to taste the grapes.
She has HAD a hearty meal to refresh the inner woman.
sentences.chinese: 她美餐了一頓，大飽了口福。

sentences.english: We hope you'll also get a feast for your appetite.
sentences.chinese: 也希望這淮揚菜能讓您大飽口福。

sentences.english: I always come here when I want to be well fed.
sentences.chinese: 當我想飽口福時，我總是來這裏撮一頓。

sentences.english: We feasted on chicken and coconuts.
sentences.chinese: 我們喫雞肉和椰子，大飽口福。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, the grandmother would not have this and other delicious food of the.
sentences.chinese: 只可惜，外婆不會有這等口福了。

sentences.english: But I think it not only gluts my appetite.
sentences.chinese: 不過我覺得這些不光能讓人大飽口福。

sentences.english: You'll enjoy the special Sea-food of Bohai Bay.
sentences.chinese: 渤海灣特有的海鮮更是讓您一飽口福。

sentences.english: I'm getting a great feast today.
It seems we'll have gourmet's luck today.
sentences.chinese: 看來我們今天真是可以大飽口福了。

sentences.english: So on and so forth, this makes another reason which urges me to go to Xi'an for a visit.
sentences.chinese: 我選擇去西安遊歷的目的之二去大飽一次口福。

definition: a treat for the eyes/the rare chance of seeing sth beautiful
to eat one's fill/to have a good meal
to taste a small amount/to sample
to chew on a large slab (idiom); a large mouthful is hard to chew/to tuck into a great meal
to smell, look and taste great
